{"step_by_step_thinking": "The phrenic nerve is a mixed motor/sensory nerve which originates from the C3-C5 spinal nerves in the neck. The nerve is important for breathing because it provides exclusive motor control of the diaphragm, the primary muscle of respiration. This information is mentioned in multiple documents, such as Document [2], Document [0], Document [19], and Document [10]. Therefore, the phrenic nerve chiefly supplies the diaphragm.", "answer_choice": "B"}
